info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:50PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Lewis and Clark and northwestern Jefferson Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 448 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Helena, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding and minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Helena, Clancy, Rimini and Alhambra. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
